entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued February 27 at 10:36PM AKST until March 01 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY SNOW LIKELY STARTING TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .A rapidly strengthening low will develop in the Gulf of Alaska during the day on Tuesday. This low is expected to move towards the northern gulf coast before stalling out during the day on Wednesday. Precipitation will begin in the Yakutat area before extending to the south during the overnight hours of Tuesday

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 8:07PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW POSSIBLE FOR ANCHORAGE HILLSIDE AND SEWARD HIGHWAY ON TUESDAY... A winter storm moving into Southcentral could affect the Tuesday morning commute around Anchorage. Reduced visibility in blowing snow is possible, especially along the Anchorage Hillside and the Seward Highway corridor along Turnagain Arm. Please use caution

entry.summary: ...Possible Refreeze of Wet Roads Overnight... Roads that remain wet or have standing water on them from Monday`s rainfall may turn icy overnight as temperatures slowly fall below freezing. These issues will be most prevalent on secondary and untreated roadways that have poor drainage. Be alert for these icy locations if driving and be prepared to slow down.
